etymology.description: Two pieces of 肉(肉) (ròu, "meat") -> bronze script corruption to 夕(夕) (xī, "evening") -> duplication of 夕 represented many
etymology.interpretation: The original representation of two pieces of meat symbolized abundance, with the corruption to 夕 making the character express the idea of 'many' through duplication, akin to the concept of 林(林) (lín, "forest") from 木(木) (mù, "tree; wood").

examples.chinese: 公园里有很多人(公園裡有很多人)。
examples.english: There are many people in the park.

examples.chinese: 这个城市有很多高楼(這個城市有很多高樓)，也有许多美丽的公园(也有許多美麗的公園)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège chéngshì yǒu hěnduō gāolóu, yě yǒu xǔduō měilì de gōngyuán.
examples.english: This city has many tall buildings, and also many beautiful parks.
